subject: p19075045
Findings: There has been interval improved appearance of the lungs with more well-defined vasculature and decreased left effusion. However, there continues to be a dense left upper lobe infiltrate. It is unclear how much of this is due to volume loss/retained secretions or if there could be an underlying infectious infiltrate. There continue to be patchy areas of alveolar edema however, the overall appearance of the lungs is markedly improved compared to the study from the prior day. The supporting devices, lines and tubes appear similar compared to prior.
